Package db

Class DBController

java.lang.Object
db.DBController
public class DBController extends Object
DBController handles all DB operations related to the BPARK database. This class implements the Singleton pattern to ensure a single shared connection to the database throughout the runtime of the application.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static DBController getInstance()
      Returns the single instance of the DBController. If it doesn't exist, creates a new one.
      Returns:
      the singleton instance

    • connectToDB

      public static void connectToDB()
      Establishes connection to the MySQL database. Loads the JDBC driver and connects to the local DB.

    • disconnectFromDB

      public void disconnectFromDB()
      Closes the connection to the database.

    • updateParkingSpace

      public boolean updateParkingSpace(int newParkingSpace, int orderNumber)
      Updates the parking space assigned to a specific order in the database.
      Parameters:
      newParkingSpace - The new parking space number to assign.
      orderNumber - The unique identifier of the order to update.
      Returns:
      true if the order was found and updated, false otherwise.

    • authenticateUser

      public User authenticateUser(String username, String password)
      Authenticates a user using their username and password. If the credentials match a record in the 'user' table, returns a User object with their assigned role. The password is not returned in the User object for security reasons.
      Parameters:
      username - the username provided by the client
      password - the password provided by the client
      Returns:
      a User object (username + role) if authentication succeeds, or null if it fails

    • subscriberExists

      public boolean subscriberExists(int subscriberCode)
      Checks if a subscriber with the given subscriberCode exists in the database.
      Parameters:
      subscriberCode - the code to check
      Returns:
      true if exists, false otherwise

    • getSubscriberCodeByTag

      public int getSubscriberCodeByTag(String tagId)
      Retrieves the subscriber code associated with a given tag ID. This version performs a case-sensitive match using the BINARY keyword.
      Parameters:
      tagId - the tag identifier (e.g. "TAG_001")
      Returns:
      the subscriberCode if found, or -1 if not found or error

    • getOpenParkingEvent

      public ParkingEvent getOpenParkingEvent(int subscriberCode, int parkingCode) throws SQLException
      Retrieves the latest open parking event for the specified subscriber and parking code. An event is considered open if its exitDate is null (i.e., the vehicle has not exited yet).
      Parameters:
      subscriberCode - the subscriber's unique identifier
      parkingCode - the numeric code assigned when the vehicle entered
      Returns:
      a ParkingEvent object if a match is found; null otherwise
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs

    • handleVehiclePickup

      public String handleVehiclePickup(int subscriberCode, int parkingCode)
      Handles the vehicle pickup process for a subscriber. First, retrieves the active parking event by subscriber and parking code. Then finalizes the parking and calculates total hours parked. Allowed duration is up to 4 hours normally, or 8 hours if extended. If the parking duration exceeds the allowed time, a delay is recorded. A notification is printed to the console (email/SMS sent by the server).
      Parameters:
      subscriberCode - the subscriber's code
      parkingCode - the parking code provided by the subscriber
      Returns:
      String with a matched message to the caseֲ thatֲ occurred

    • updateWasExtended

      public boolean updateWasExtended(int subscriberCode)
      Updates the latest parking event for the subscriber to indicate it was extended.
      Parameters:
      subscriberCode - the subscriber's code
      Returns:
      true if the update succeeded, false otherwise

    • parkingLotList

      public ArrayList<String> parkingLotList()
      Retrieves the names of all parking lots from the database.
      Returns:
      list of parking lot names

    • parkingSpaceCheckingForNewOrder

      public boolean parkingSpaceCheckingForNewOrder(Date date, Time time)
      Checks if at least 40% of the parking spaces are available for a new order at the given date and time. This ensures availability before confirming a reservation.
      Parameters:
      date - date of the desired reservation
      time - time of the desired reservation
      Returns:
      true if reservation is allowed, false otherwise

    • setOrderId

      public void setOrderId(Order newOrder)
      Updates the given Order object with its order number based on matching fields in the database. The match is done using order date, arrival time, and parking space.
      Parameters:
      newOrder - the Order object to update with its order number

    • placingAnNewOrder

      public boolean placingAnNewOrder(Order newOrder)
      Places a new order and inserts it into the orders table in the database. Also automatically assigns an available parking space and sets the order ID if the insert succeeds.
      Parameters:
      newOrder - the Order object containing all the order details
      Returns:
      true if the order was successfully saved to the database, false if something failed

    • getDetailsOfSubscriber

      public Subscriber getDetailsOfSubscriber(User user)
      Retrieves the subscriber's full details after successful user login. Looks up the subscriber in the database using the provided username and returns a populated Subscriber object (excluding password).
      Parameters:
      user - the User object containing the username to search by
      Returns:
      a Subscriber object with full profile information if found; null if no match was found or an error occurred

    • checkSubscriberHasReservationNow

      public boolean checkSubscriberHasReservationNow(int subscriberCode)
      Checks whether the given subscriber has a valid reservation at the current date and time. A reservation is considered valid only if: - The reservation date is today. - The current time is within 15 minutes after the scheduled arrival time. For example: if a reservation is for 08:00, it is only valid between 08:00 and 08:15. After 08:15, entry is no longer allowed.
      Parameters:
      subscriberCode - The unique identifier of the subscriber to check.
      Returns:
      true if a valid reservation exists now, false otherwise.

    • checkConfirmationCode

      public boolean checkConfirmationCode(int subscriberCode, int confirmationCode)
      Checks if a subscriber has a valid reservation with a specific confirmation code and that the current time is within 15 minutes from the arrival time.
      Parameters:
      subscriberCode - The subscriber code to check
      confirmationCode - The confirmation code to verify
      Returns:
      true if a valid reservation with the given confirmation code exists and the current time is within the allowed window, false otherwise

    • hasAvailableSpots

      public int hasAvailableSpots(String parkingLotName, int subscriberCode)
      Checks if thereג€™s at least one free parking space in the given parking lot, taking into account both currently parked vehicles and future reservations. Here's how it works: - If a spot is available, it picks one thatג€™s not currently occupied and not reserved for someone arriving now. - If the subscriber has a valid reservation starting now, reserved spots are also considered. - Once a spot is found, it gets marked as occupied both in the database and in the parking lot counters.
      Parameters:
      parkingLotName - the name of the parking lot (e.g., "Braude")
      subscriberCode - the subscriber's code (used to check if they have a reservation)
      Returns:
      the ID of an available parking spot, or -1 if the lot is full

    • addParkingEvent

      public void addParkingEvent(ParkingEvent parkingEvent)
      Inserts a new parking event into the 'parkingevent' table in the database.
      Parameters:
      parkingEvent - The ParkingEvent object containing all the event data to be stored.

    • findVehicleID

      public String findVehicleID(int subscriberCode)
      Finds the vehicle ID associated with the given subscriber code. Executes a query on the 'vehicle' table to retrieve the vehicleId for the specified subscriberCode.
      Parameters:
      subscriberCode - the unique code of the subscriber.
      Returns:
      the vehicle ID if found, otherwise -1.

    • getFutureReservationsForSubscriber

      public ArrayList<Order> getFutureReservationsForSubscriber(Subscriber subscriber)
      Gets all active future reservations for a given subscriber. Only returns orders that are scheduled to start more than 15 minutes from now.
      Parameters:
      subscriber - the subscriber whose reservations we want to check
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of the subscriber's upcoming reservations, or null if an error occurs

    • deleteOrder

      public boolean deleteOrder(int orderNumber)
      Cancels an order by updating its status to 'CANCELLED' in the database.
      Parameters:
      orderNumber - the unique ID of the order to cancel
      Returns:
      true if the update was successful (order was found and cancelled), false otherwise

      Returns:
      if the action succeed

    • duplicatePhone

      public boolean duplicatePhone(String phone, int subCode)
      Checks if another subscriber is already using this phone number.
      Parameters:
      phone - the phone number to check
      subCode - the current subscriber's code (to exclude themself)
      Returns:
      true if another subscriber has this phone number, false otherwise

    • duplicateEmail

      public boolean duplicateEmail(String email, int subCode)
      Checks if another subscriber already uses this email.
      Parameters:
      email - the email to check
      subCode - the subscriber's own code (so we can ignore their own record)
      Returns:
      true if another subscriber has the same email, false otherwise

    • parkingHistoryOfSubscriber

      public ArrayList<ParkingEvent> parkingHistoryOfSubscriber(Subscriber subscriber)
      Retrieves the full parking history of a given subscriber.
      Parameters:
      subscriber - the subscriber whose parking events are requested
      Returns:
      a list of ParkingEvent objects representing the subscriber's parking history, or null if an error occurs during retrieval

    • tagExists

      public boolean tagExists(String tag)
      Checks whether a subscriber with the given tag ID exists in the database.
      Parameters:
      tag - the tag ID to check (e.g., "TAG_001")
      Returns:
      true if the tag exists in the database; false otherwise

    • seekForTheSubscriberWithTag

      public int seekForTheSubscriberWithTag(String tag)
      Retrieves the subscriber code associated with the given tag ID.
      Parameters:
      tag - the tag ID to look up (e.g., "TAG_001")
      Returns:
      the subscriber code if found; -1 if not found or an error occurs

    • checkSubscriberEntered

      public boolean checkSubscriberEntered(int codeInt)
      Checks whether the subscriber currently has an active parking event, meaning they have entered the parking lot and not yet exited.
      Parameters:
      codeInt - the subscriber's unique code
      Returns:
      true if the subscriber has an open parking event (i.e., vehicle is inside); false otherwise

    • checkTagIDEntered

      public boolean checkTagIDEntered(String tag)
      Checks whether the vehicle associated with the given tag ID is currently inside the parking lot (i.e., has an active parking event with no recorded exit time).
      Parameters:
      tag - the tag ID associated with the vehicle (e.g., "TAG_001")
      Returns:
      true if the vehicle is currently inside the parking lot; false otherwise

    • getEmailAndPhoneNumber

      public String[] getEmailAndPhoneNumber(int subscriberCode)
      Retrieves the email and phone number of a subscriber by their subscriber code.
      Parameters:
      subscriberCode - the unique code of the subscriber
      Returns:
      a String array where index 0 is email and index 1 is phone number, or null if the subscriber was not found or an error occurred

    • getAllSubscribersWithLateCount

      public List<Object[]> getAllSubscribersWithLateCount()
      Returns all subscribers along with how many times each one was late. A late is counted if: - The parking duration was over 8 hours. - Or it was over 4 hours and was not extended. Ongoing and completed events are both included.
      Returns:
      List of Object[] where: [0] = Subscriber [1] = Number of late parkings (Integer)

    • getActiveParkingEvents

      public List<ParkingEvent> getActiveParkingEvents()
      Retrieves all active (open) parking events from the database. Active events are those that have no recorded exit date/time.
      Returns:
      a list of ParkingEvent objects

    • getActiveParkingEvent

      public ParkingEvent getActiveParkingEvent(Subscriber subscriber)
      Retrieves the active parking event for a given subscriber. A parking event is considered active if it has no recorded exit time.
      Parameters:
      subscriber - the subscriber whose active parking event is requested
      Returns:
      the active ParkingEvent if found, or null if not found or error occurs

    • extendParkingSession

      public String extendParkingSession(int parkingCode, String subscriberCode)
      Attempts to extend an active parking session based on the given parking code. The extension will succeed only if all of the following conditions are met: - The parking session is still active (exitDate and exitHour are NULL) - The session has not been extended before (wasExtended = FALSE) - If a subscriberCode is provided (not null or blank), the session must belong to that subscriber - The number of allowed extensions (based on upcoming reservations) has not been exceeded If subscriberCode is null or blank (used from terminal), the extension will be attempted using only the parking code without checking subscriber ownership.
      Parameters:
      parkingCode - the code identifying the parking session
      subscriberCode - the subscriber's code (may be null or blank if called from terminal)
      Returns:
      a String message indicating success or the reason for failure

    • decrementRemainingExtensions

      public void decrementRemainingExtensions(String lotName)
      Decreases the number of remaining extensions for the lot (if more than 0).
      Parameters:
      lotName - the name of the parking lot

    • extensionWouldBlockReservation

      public boolean extensionWouldBlockReservation()
      Checks if no extensions are allowed due to upcoming reservations.
      Returns:
      true if extensions should be blocked, false if there is still capacity

    • updateRemainingExtensionCapacity

      public void updateRemainingExtensionCapacity(String lotName)
      Updates the extension capacity in the DB based on current lot status. This method recalculates how many users can still extend their parking.
      Parameters:
      lotName - the name of the parking lot

    • getTotalSpots

      public int getTotalSpots(String lotName)
      Gets the total number of parking spots in a lot.
      Parameters:
      lotName - the lot name
      Returns:
      number of total spots, or 0 if error

    • getUpcomingReservationCount

      public int getUpcomingReservationCount(String lotName)
      Counts how many active orders are scheduled to arrive in the next 4 hours. These affect the limit on who can extend parking.
      Parameters:
      lotName - the lot name
      Returns:
      number of upcoming reservations

    • getExtendedParkingsCount

      public int getExtendedParkingsCount(String lotName)
      Returns how many active sessions in the lot have already been extended.
      Parameters:
      lotName - the lot name
      Returns:
      number of extended (and still active) sessions

    • subscriberIsLate

      public boolean subscriberIsLate(int subscriberCode)
      Checks if the subscriber is late based on parking time and extension status. The check is accurate to the minute: if more than 240 minutes (4 hours) have passed, the subscriber is considered late.
      Parameters:
      subscriberCode - the subscriber's code
      Returns:
      true if the subscriber is late, false otherwise

    • hasReservationInNext4Hours

      public boolean hasReservationInNext4Hours()
      Checks whether there's an upcoming reservation in the next 4 hours. This helps prevent extending if it might block someone else.
      Returns:
      true if there is a reservation coming soon

    • getNextSubscriberCode

      public int getNextSubscriberCode()
      Generates the next available subscriber code by retrieving the current maximum value from the database and adding 1. If the table is empty (i.e., no subscribers exist), returns the default starting value 1011.
      Returns:
      the next available subscriber code

    • generateNextTagId

      public String generateNextTagId()
      Generates the next unique tag ID for a new subscriber in the format "TAG_XXX", where XXX is a zero-padded sequence number based on the current number of subscribers. For example: if there are 15 subscribers, returns "TAG_016".
      Returns:
      the newly generated tag ID; returns "TAG_999" if an error occurs

    • insertSubscriber

      public boolean insertSubscriber(Subscriber s)
      Inserts a new subscriber into the database.
      Parameters:
      s - the subscriber object to insert
      Returns:
      true if insertion succeeded

    • insertUser

      public boolean insertUser(User user)
      Inserts a new user into the database.
      Parameters:
      user - the user object containing username, password, and role
      Returns:
      true if the user was successfully inserted, false otherwise

    • insertVehicle

      public boolean insertVehicle(String vehicleId, int subscriberCode)
      Inserts a new vehicle and assigns it to a subscriber.
      Parameters:
      vehicleId - the vehicle ID (e.g. license plate)
      subscriberCode - the subscriber this vehicle belongs to
      Returns:
      true if insertion succeeded, false otherwise

      public boolean vehicleExists(String vehicleId)

      Parameters:
      vehicleId - the vehicle ID to check
      Returns:
      true if the vehicle already exists, false otherwise

      public boolean emailExists(String email)
      Checks whether the provided email is already associated with an existing subscriber.
      Parameters:
      email - the email to check
      Returns:
      true if the email exists, false otherwise

    • usernameExists

      public boolean usernameExists(String username)
      Checks whether a **case-sensitive** username already exists.
      Parameters:
      username - exact username to check
      Returns:
      true if username is taken

    • phoneExists

      public boolean phoneExists(String phone)
      Checks if a phone number already exists in the subscriber table.
      Parameters:
      phone - the phone number to check
      Returns:
      true if the phone exists, false otherwise

    • idExists

      public boolean idExists(String userId)
      Checks if a user ID (ID) already exists in the subscriber table.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      true if the ID exists, false otherwise

    • getActiveParkingEventsThatLateAndDoesntReceiveMail

      public ArrayList<ParkingEvent> getActiveParkingEventsThatLateAndDoesntReceiveMail()
      Retrieves all active (open) parking events that late for retrieve car and doesn't receive mail from the database. Active events are those that have no recorded exit date.
      Returns:
      a list of ParkingEvent objects

    • markSendMail

      public void markSendMail(int subscriberCode)
      Marks a subscriber as having been notified for being late. This sets the 'sendMsgForLating' flag to true for their active parking event.
      Parameters:
      subscriberCode - the code identifying the subscriber

    • getTotalSpots

      public int getTotalSpots()
      Returns the total number of parking spots in the lot.
      Returns:
      total number of parkingSpaces

    • getOccupiedSpots

      public int getOccupiedSpots()
      Returns the number of currently occupied parking spots.
      Returns:
      count of spots where is_occupied = TRUE

    • getUpcomingReservations

      public int getUpcomingReservations()
      Counts how many upcoming reservations (orders) are scheduled to start in the next 4 hours from now. We only care about ACTIVE orders that are expected soon. This is used to limit how many people can extend their parking, so reserved spots won't be stolen.
      Returns:
      number of upcoming reservations within the next 4 hours

    • createParkingReport

      public void createParkingReport(Date date)
      Creates a new parking report for the previous month and saves it to the database. The report data is calculated based on parking events and then inserted into the parkingReport table.
      Parameters:
      date - the date the report is being created for (usually the first day of the month)

    • parkingReportExists

      public boolean parkingReportExists(Date date)
      check existence of parking report on database for creating only the missing reports.
      Parameters:
      date - (of month that we want to check)
      Returns:
      true if exists. false if doesn't.

    • getParkingReport

      public ParkingReport getParkingReport(Date date)
      Gets the parking report for a specific date from the database. This is usually used when a manager wants to view the report for a certain day.
      Parameters:
      date - the date of the parking report
      Returns:
      a ParkingReport object if found, or null if no report exists or an error occurs

    • getSubscriberStatusLive

      public List<SubscriberStatusReport> getSubscriberStatusLive(int month, int year) throws SQLException
      Returns a list of subscriber statistics (entries, extends, lates, hours) for the selected month and year ג€“ calculated directly from parkingEvent. This method does NOT store anything in the database, it's used for real-time calculation only (read-only).
      Parameters:
      month - calendar month (1 = January, ..., 12 = December)
      year - full year (e.g. 2025)
      Returns:
      list of subscriber rows with usage data
      Throws:
      SQLException - if something goes wrong during the query

    • storeSubscriberStatusReport

      public int storeSubscriberStatusReport(int month, int year) throws SQLException
      Generates and stores a fixed snapshot of all subscribersג€™ activity for a given month+year. This method: Fetches fresh data using getSubscriberStatusLive() Deletes any existing snapshot for that month (if already exists) Inserts a new set of records into subscriberStatusReport Used by the monthly report generator (automatic or manual).
      Parameters:
      month - calendar month to save (1-12)
      year - year to save (4-digit)
      Returns:
      number of rows inserted (equals number of subscribers)
      Throws:
      SQLException - if the DB insert fails

    • getSubscriberStatusFromTable

      public List<SubscriberStatusReport> getSubscriberStatusFromTable(int month, int year) throws SQLException
      Reads the saved subscriber snapshot from the database for a given month+year. This is the version used when the report was already generated and stored (instead of calculating it again).
      Parameters:
      month - month of the report (1-12)
      year - year of the report (e.g. 2025)
      Returns:
      list of subscriber statistics for that period (can be empty)
      Throws:
      SQLException - if database access fails

    • subscriberStatusReportExists

      public boolean subscriberStatusReportExists(int month, int year) throws SQLException
      Checks if there is already at least one row in subscriberStatusReport for the given month and year. Used to prevent creating the same report twice.
      Parameters:
      month - month to check (1-12)
      year - year to check (4-digit)
      Returns:
      true if snapshot exists, false otherwise
      Throws:
      SQLException - if DB check fails

    • checkIfOrderAlreadyExists

      public boolean checkIfOrderAlreadyExists(int subscriberCode, Date selectedDate, Time timeOfArrival)
      Checks whether the given subscriber already has an active order for the specified date and arrival time.
      Parameters:
      subscriberCode - the subscriber's unique code
      selectedDate - the date of the desired reservation
      timeOfArrival - the time of the desired reservation
      Returns:
      true if an active order already exists for the same date and time; false otherwise

    • getAllReportsDates

      public ArrayList<Date> getAllReportsDates()
      Retrieves all existing dates for which a parking report has been generated.
      Returns:
      a list of dates representing existing parking reports; null if an error occurs during retrieval

    • inactiveReservations

      public void inactiveReservations()
      set inactive order after 15 minutes from arrival time

    • hasReservationConflict

      public boolean hasReservationConflict(int subscriberCode, Date selectedDate, Time arrivalTime)
      Checks if this subscriber already has an ACTIVE reservation within +4 or -4 hours (240 min) of the date-time they just picked. Exact same time counts as a clash, so you canג€™t double-book.
      Parameters:
      subscriberCode - subscriberג€™s numeric code
      selectedDate - date the user chose
      arrivalTime - time the user chose
      Returns:
      true if we hit an overlap, false if the slot is free

    • markUserLoggedIn

      public boolean markUserLoggedIn(String username) throws SQLException
      Tries to log in the given user by setting their is_logged_in flag to 1. This only works if the user was logged out before.
      Parameters:
      username - the exact username (case-sensitive)
      Returns:
      true if the login flag was set (user was offline and is now marked as online) false if the user was already logged in
      Throws:
      SQLException - if something goes wrong with the database

    • markUserLoggedOut

      public void markUserLoggedOut(String username)
      Clears the online flag of the user (called on LOGOUT / disconnect).
      Parameters:
      username - exact username

    • isUserOnline

      public boolean isUserOnline(String username)
      Checks whether the given username is currently flagged as online (i.e., is_logged_in = 1 in the user table).
      Parameters:
      username - exact username to check (case sensitive)
      Returns:
      true if the user is marked online, false otherwise or if a DB error occurs

    • resetAllLoggedIn

      public void resetAllLoggedIn()
      Resets the is_logged_in flag for **all** users to 0. Called once at server startup to clear stale sessions.
